rows.title: Mozilla Firefox denial of service
rows.description: Mozilla Firefox is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a use-after-free when applying update on macOS. By persuading a victim to visit a specially crafted Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the browser to crash.
rows.remedy: Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-01 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.
rows.remedy_fmt: Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-01 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

references.description: Security Vulnerabilities fixed in Firefox 122

rows.title: Google Chrome security bypass
rows.description: Google Chrome could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by insufficient policy enforcement in iOS Security UI. By persuading a victim to visit a specially crafted Web site, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions.
rows.remedy: Upgrade to the latest version of Google Chrome (121.0.6167.85 or 121.0.6167.86 or later), available from the Google Chrome Releases Web site. See References.
rows.remedy_fmt: Upgrade to the latest version of Google Chrome (121.0.6167.85 or 121.0.6167.86 or later), available from the Google Chrome Releases Web site. See References.

rows.title: Mozilla Firefox security bypass
rows.description: Mozilla Firefox could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by the failure to update user input timestamp. By persuading a victim to visit a specially crafted Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to activate or dismiss certain browser prompts and dialogs.
rows.remedy: Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-01 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.
rows.remedy_fmt: Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-01 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

rows.description: Mozilla Firefox could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error related to specific HSTS configurations. By persuading a victim to visit a specially crafted Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to HSTS on a subdomain.
rows.remedy: Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-01 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

rows.title: Mozilla Firefox security bypass
rows.description: Mozilla Firefox could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error when the directive unsafe-inline was set. By persuading a victim to visit a specially crafted Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to allow the parent Content Security Policy to override the child Content Security Policy.
rows.remedy: Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-01 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.
rows.remedy_fmt: Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-01 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

rows.title: Westermo Lynx 206-F2G cross-site scripting
rows.description: Westermo Lynx 206-F2G is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker within the local network could exploit this vulnerability using a specially crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.
rows.remedy: No remedy available as of January 23, 2024.
rows.remedy_fmt: No remedy available as of January 23, 2024.

references.description: Westermo Lynx 206-F2G

rows.remedy: Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-01 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

rows.title: Mozilla Firefox code execution
rows.description: Mozilla Firefox could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by memory safety bugs within the browser engine. rows.title: Westermo Lynx 206-F2G cross-site request forgery
rows.description: Westermo Lynx 206-F2G is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote authenticated attacker could send a malformed HTTP request to carry out unintended actions. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.
rows.remedy: No remedy available as of January 23, 2024.
rows.remedy_fmt: No remedy available as of January 23, 2024.

rows.title: Multiple Yamaha wireless LAN access point devices command execution
rows.description: Multiple Yamaha wireless LAN access point devices could allow a remote authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by the use of an active debugging port. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the system.
rows.remedy: Refer to Yamaha Corporation Web site for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See references.
rows.remedy_fmt: Refer to Yamaha Corporation Web site for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See references.

rows.title: Westermo Lynx 206-F2G cross-site scripting
rows.description: Westermo Lynx 206-F2G is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote authenticated attacker within the local network could exploit this vulnerability using the dns.0.server parameter to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.
rows.remedy: No remedy available as of January 23, 2024.
rows.remedy_fmt: No remedy available as of January 23, 2024.

rows.title: Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries Electronic Delivery Check System XML external entity injection
rows.description: Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries Electronic Delivery Check System is vulnerable to an XML external entity injection (XXE) attack when processing XML data, caused by a weakly configured XML parser. By persuading a victim to use specially crafted XML content, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to read arbitrary files, conduct an SSRF attack, or achieve other system impacts.
rows.remedy: Refer to Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries Web site for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See references.
rows.remedy_fmt: Refer to Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries Web site for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See references.
platforms_affected: Japanese Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries Electronic Delivery Check System 14.0.001.002

references.description: Improper restriction of XML external entity references (XXE) in MLIT "Electronic Delivery Check System" and "Electronic delivery item Inspection Support System"

references.link_name: Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries Web site
references.description: Electronic delivery check system (Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries Agriculture and Rural Development Project version)

rows.title: Westermo Lynx 206-F2G cross-site scripting
rows.description: Westermo Lynx 206-F2G is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the SNMP configuration. A remote authenticated attacker within the local network could exploit this vulnerability using the username parameter to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.
rows.remedy: No remedy available as of January 23, 2024.
rows.remedy_fmt: No remedy available as of January 23, 2024.

references.description: Westermo Lynx 206-F2G
Westermo

rows.title: Linux Kernel information disclosure
rows.description: Linux Kernel could allow a local authenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a use-after-free flaw in the __ext4_remount function at fs/ext4/super.c. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information, and use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.
rows.remedy: Refer to Linux Kernel Web site for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See references.
rows.remedy_fmt: Refer to Linux Kernel Web site for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See references.

references.description: commit 536ecbd569cb99b2e8a4422c43926590c7893aef
ext4: improve error recovery code paths in __ext4_remount()
CVE-2024-0775 kernel: use-after-free while changing the mount option in __ext4_remount leading

A use-after-free flaw was found in the __ext4_remount in fs/ext4/super.c in ext4 in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a local user to cause an information leak problem while freeing the old quota file names before a potential failure, leading to a use-after-free.

rows.title: Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries Electronic Delivery Check System XML external entity injection
rows.description: Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries Electronic Delivery Check System is vulnerable to an XML external entity injection (XXE) attack when processing XML data, caused by a weakly configured XML parser. By persuading a victim to use specially crafted XML content, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to read arbitrary files, conduct an SSRF attack, or achieve other system impacts.
rows.remedy: Refer to Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries Web site for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See references.
rows.remedy_fmt: Refer to Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries Web site for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See references.

rows.title: Westermo Lynx 206-F2G cross-site scripting
rows.description: Westermo Lynx 206-F2G is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the autorefresh parameter to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.
rows.remedy: No remedy available as of January 23, 2024.
rows.remedy_fmt: No remedy available as of January 23, 2024.

rows.title: ELECOM routers command execution
rows.description: ELECOM routers could allow a remote authenticated attacker within the local network to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by an OS command injection vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the system.
rows.remedy: Refer to ELECOM Security Bulletin EL39-218 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.
rows.remedy_fmt: Refer to ELECOM Security Bulletin EL39-218 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

rows.title: Spoon weak security
rows.description: Spoon could provide weaker than expected security, caused by the use of a hardcoded cryptographic key. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to launch further attacks on the system.
rows.remedy: Upgrade to the latest version of Spoon (8.6.1 or later), available from the Google Play Store Web site. See references.
rows.remedy_fmt: Upgrade to the latest version of Spoon (8.6.1 or later), available from the Google Play Store Web site. See references.
